Posts.Content: Good luck, you won't regret it :-)
Posts.Title: Eyrbrows still thin

Posts.Content: hd
Posts.Title: Eyrbrows still thin

Posts.Content: Yep it was needaname.  The girl I went to see drew them on to let me see how they would look.  I didn't want huge he eyebrows.   Winney xx
Posts.Title: Eyrbrows still thin

Posts.Content: Hi I had my eyebrows semi permanently tattooed and I love them!  Only advice I was given was to do your research into where you have them done both in terms of hygiene and what they'll look like at the end.  It was expensive enough mine cost £300 and I'll have to have them topped up once a year but it was worth every penny.  Now just have to work on getting rid of the chemo curls!!!! Winney xx
Posts.Title: Eyrbrows still thin

Posts.Content: Thanks Sue, I am so glad to hear that!!!!  I was only at the consultant yesterday so hopefully I'll calm down eventually.  Think you're right we'll never truly relax.  I was diagnosed Feb this year so probably need more practice at not panicking!! Thanks again Winney xx
Posts.Title: Back and shoulder pain

Posts.Content: Hi, I've finished my chemo in September and radiotherapy in October for Her2 positive breast cancer  I've also started taking anastrozole I now have terrible back and shoulder pain.  Now Im petrified the cancer has gone into my bones.  I've found I'm much more worried and paranoid now I've finished treatment than what I was during it.  I am getting herceptin injections too.  Just feel my comfort blanket has gone. I had a clear bone scan 6 months ago and my consultant has ordered another one but probably won't have it until after Xmas.  Don't know how I'll cope until then.  I'm convinced it's now everywhere!!!  I've been told anastrozole can give joint pain but has anyone had back and shoulder pains while on this that doesn't involve joints?  Sorry for the disjointed ramble!!!! Thanks Winney  x
Posts.Title: Back and shoulder pain

Posts.Content: And to you too Sue xx
Posts.Title: Back and shoulder pain

Posts.Content: Thanks, the codeine isn't doing anything for me either.  I'll ask talk to them about your suggestion.
Posts.Title: Numbness and nerve pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi I had my mastectomy on 13 March and have some questions I'm hoping someone will be able to help me with. Has anyone any idea how long it takes the wound to heal and the pain to subside? I'm having trouble with numbness in my arm and side along with nerve pain.  Has anyone any idea how long this will last and any ideas of what I can do to improve it.  Don't want to take nerve pain medication as I'm due to start chemo on Monday,   I'd appreciate any ideas... thanks. Winney
Posts.Title: Numbness and nerve pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks Gay it's reassuring to know the numbness eases at least some, between that and the tingling it's a weird feeling.  I had full clearance too.  I'm taking my max pain killers at present though I think it doesn't do much for the nerve pain.  Guess I'll just have to sit it out.  Xx
Posts.Title: Numbness and nerve pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi your right hand side is exactly the stage I'm at now.  Good to hear from someone who is experiencing the same thing.  Started to think I was going mad.  Don't know what I expected but I didn't think it would be so painful.  Roll on 6 weeks!!
Posts.Title: Numbness and nerve pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Awww thanks Karen that's good to hear.  I had total clearance of nodes at the time of my mastectomy and I guess that's what's causing my arm trouble.  Good to know it'll settle down it's just so painful at the minute seems like it's been going on forever....  I'll be on countdown now!!!
Posts.Title: Numbness and nerve pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Elsie The nurses always take my blood pressure over my PICC line.  Fortunately I've never had a problem and it isn't particularly painful either.  I guess it depends on if you've had probs with it. Winney
Posts.Title: Blood pressure cuff and PICC line

Posts.Content: Hi, I am exactly the same.  Finished treatment end of October 2017 too.  Only once my treatment finished did I start to freak out.  Constantly worry about the cancer coming back, think I imagine aches and pains.  I can't sleep either I'm on anastrazole too, didn't realise that was a side effect.  I've started counselling, not too sure how it will go as yet.  You're right sometimes you are positive and other times it's really hard.  I even find myself reluctant to plan things as I'm worried what my position will be then.  Sorry I can't be much more help as I'm really at the same stage as you. Normal isn't normal any more.....  Good luck.
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Not sure Gail but is this the link you are talking about?  (I'm not real good either, hope it works!) http://www.workingwithcancer.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2013/03/After-the-treatment-finishes-then-what.pdf Winney
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Yep Bonny think this relates to any catastrophic event.  Your diagnosis is obviously at least the second life changing event to affect you.  I can't imagine what it would be like to lose a husband with teenage children.  Sometimes I think people don't know what to say and end up saying the worst things possible.  I'll scream if one more person tells me how well I look..... etc".  I've had a mastectomy, chemo, radiotherapy, now Herceptin.  Hair just started coming back and it's grey!!  I look anything but well!!  I think to myself wow you must have looked a treat before!!  :-)  You're obviously a strong person and worked through the process without knowing it.  Sometimes it's common sense when you're suddenly faced with something you have no control over especially if you have children depending on you but it's still nice to have it confirmed for you.  I'm still a work in progress.  Good luck with your treatment. Winney x
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Thanks Shey, that's exactly where my pain is and I also had 15 sessions of radiotherapy.  So what you're saying makes sense.  I will mention it next time I'm speaking to the BC nurses.  Funny how you're mind goes into overdrive with every ache and pain.  That has eased my mind a bit.  Thanks again.  Virtual celebration sound good.  I'll never get used to that injection...... Winney xx
Posts.Title: Herceptin and muscle pain

Posts.Content: Hi, I finish my Herceptin in July too.  Also had a mastectomy.  I also have pains in my legs and arms etc, but not as bad as some of you ladies seem to have.  My worst problem is pain in my upper back, lung area, mainly on my mastectomy side but it sometimes moves to the other side.  I'm on Alendronic acid tablets for osteoporosis and Anastrozole tablets.  Does anyone else have this problem?   Winney xx
Posts.Title: Herceptin and muscle pain

Posts.Content: You’re right Georgia you do get through it exactly because there is no other option especially if you want belt and braces.  I was diagnosed 2016 had a mastectomy, FEC T chemo and radiotherapy.  It’s not pleasant but very doable.  Just make sure you take the medication given and all the rest you can.  Good luck. Winney
Posts.Title: About to start my chemo journey

Posts.Content: Hi I'm in exactly the same position.  I had small nodes on my lung whic I was told were of no concern.  My latest scan I was told "lung nodes are more pronounced and there was a thickening of the sternum".  Now I have another bone scan on Tuesday and a body CT scan on 10 July.  When I ask if the changes were significant I was told "all changes are significant".  Same very non specific language and going out of my mind with worry. Sorry can't give you any advice but just to let you know I'm in exactly your position too. Good luck Winney
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Hiya I'm really glad you're feeling more positive.  Actually you're ahead of me I haven't had any bone biopsies yet.  I go in the morning for a bone scan.  They may ask for bone biopsies after that.  I haven't had a reconstruction either but did have radiotherapy and didn't realise that too could cause thickening of the sternum.  That makes me a bit more positive too. Please keep me posted on how you get on Gill I'll do the same.  Though my CT scan won't be until 10th July and they'll probably wait and give me both my results at the same time.  Glad it went as well as it could have done for you under the circumstances.  The waiting is always the worst!!  Huggggs
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Oh it never leaves your head, just is a bit more doable.  Got my bone scan this morning.  A 2d scan and a 3D scan of my sternum.  Took ages!  I did ask about bringing the CT scan forward, in fact a I was going to get it done privately myself but was told not a good idea.  As my scans aren't clear exactly why these changes are taking place they need enough time between scans to see if there are further changes if that makes sense. Forgot to say I'm going to counselling too.  Not too sure.to what extent it's helping but if nothing else it gives you a safe place to spill out your fears and feelings without continually overloading family and friends.  Might be worth a thought for you if you're not already having it.  I'll be in touch and keep me posted.  Hugggggssss
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Hi Gill still waiting for me here too.  Had my bone scan on 26th June and body scan 10th July so I'm waiting on a review appointment to tell me what they showed up. Funny I was thinking about you too I'm glad you're getting closer to a plan of action.  The waiting really doesn't get any easier.  I'll keep my fingers crossed for you and let me know how you get on.  I'll keep you posted on mine too.  In the meantime try to keep your chin up hard as it is!! Huggggss Winney
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: It is way too long I ended up going to my doctor and getting an anti anxiety anti depressant tablets.  I took a week off after I got my news and being honest cried all week.  I'm back at work but haven't said to many people I'm waiting on results.  I cope with it by not talking it as when I do it tends to overwhelm me. I understand totally where your coming from.  Don't be too hard on yourself.  Huggggsss
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Yep certainly better than I was expecting.  That’s me done for 12 weeks any way.  Hope it’s more good news for both of us.  Talk soon.  Winney XX
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Thanks and you're right the waiting is the worst.  Think I'll hear nothing until around the end of July.  Let me know how you get on too.  Hugggssss
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Thanks Gill, glad you got out and had a good time.  Good luck tomorrow I'll be thinking of you and let me know how you get on. Huggggssss Winney
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: Hi Gill, so pleased for you.  Can't even imagine how relieved you are.  I got my results on Monday.  My sternum hasn't got any thicker, though she said when she looked at my previous scans my sternum was thickened on those too (so not sure what's going on there, but goodish news).  The lung nodes haven't got any bigger either, which is good too, though still not sure what they are! they found a hotspot on one rib, however they say it could also look like a broken rib which is healing.  I did fall twice and have thinning bones due to treatment.  So fingers crossed that what it is! More CT and bone scan in another 3 months.  So fingers still crossed.  Keep in touch and let me know how you're doing.  Winney x
Posts.Title: Sternum mets

Posts.Content: By the way meant to say don't let it spoil the rest of your holiday, enjoy!!! Xx
Posts.Title: Start FEC-T May 10th

Posts.Content: Hi I just had my first FEC T session 25th April.  I was dreading it!!  Like everyone says different people have different experiences.  It wasn't too bad, I was dreading the sickness.  I did have to get extra anti sickness tablets but they did work!  Uncomfortable dry mouth and funny taste.  I found it although not pleasant doable.  I have 5 more cycles to go I hope the rest of them are similar. Good luck and though it's hard try not to worry too much. Winney
Posts.Title: Start FEC-T May 10th

Posts.Content: Thanks so much Karen.  I've been put on Enalapril Mateate tablets 2.5mg for 10-14 days and if my blood pressure, kidney function etc is normal then it's to be upped to 5mg.  You're going to think I'm a woose but I don't know if my HER2 was +++ or low amplification as I'm afraid to ask.  All I know is I'm ER and HR2 positive I didn't ask and they didn't say.  I'm afraid of being told something I don't want to hear!!!!!  Does it impact on either your prognosis or chances of reoccurrence? Winney xx
Posts.Title: Herceptin - LVF

Posts.Content: Thank you so much Leolady, that’s a big relief to know.  I guess I’ll just have to get used to the waiting and learn not to panic.  It happens me when I get an unfamiliar pain also.  Cancer is a big learning curve.  I will keep you posted. Thanks Winney
Posts.Title: Possible node

Posts.Content: Oh I do hope so Sharon (for us both)!  So far they have found a thickening of my sternum which they think is nothing and a hot spot on my rib, again they don't think it's significant.  Couldn't believe it when they came up with this node!  I'm now starting to worry about the amount of radiation I'm getting but I guess we worry about everything!  I'd worry if they weren't scanning me too. Good to hear of your experience, I'm hoping it works out like that for me too. Thanks Sharon Winney.
Posts.Title: Possible node

Posts.Content: Thanks Lesley, that’s the problem you always think the worst.  It is the not knowing that’s the worst. I will try your tip hopefully it’ll do the trick.  When diagnosed with cancer it’s a whole new ball game.  Nothing seems to be clear cut or answers straight away. Thanks again  Winney
Posts.Title: Possible node

Posts.Content: Hi, I've had my 13th Herceptin injection and got a call to come into the hospital as my LV function had dropped to 45-50%.  They have put me on medication (I think an ACE inhibitor???) and deferred my last 5 Herceptin injections until hopefully heart function comes up again. Has anyone here had their Herceptin deferred because of low LV function and been able to finish their course of injections and does LV function always return to normal after treatment?  I never imagined this happening! Thanks Winney
Posts.Title: Herceptin - LVF

Posts.Content: Hi My last scan showed up an additional lung node on my left lung.  Previous lung nodes they weren’t worried about.  Hospital say it’s 3mm in size but they can’t ignore it. Banother scan in 12 weeks.  I just wanted to ask if anyone else had experience of additional lung nodes which turned out not to cancerous.  Fingers crossed!!! Thanks  Winney
Posts.Title: Possible node

Posts.Content: LOL I know what you mean Karen.  It's a fine line for me as to information I want and what I don't want to hear, it's a bit like don't mention the war but I'm getting better.  I'll take a deep breath and ask at my next appointment.  Thanks xx
Posts.Title: Herceptin - LVF
